user_persona: Maria, a 57-year-old immigrant working as a cleaner with basic English and little exposure to investment concepts.
goal: Learn the differences between a savings account and a fixed deposit, and understand which is more suitable for her emergency fund.
scenario: Maria has recently saved a small amount each month and wants to know her options for keeping her money safe and possibly earning some interest. She interacts with the assistant to get simple explanations of both options and guidance on what they are best suited for.
stopping_criterias: Maria understands the definitions and can identify the main differences between a savings account and a fixed deposit.

user_persona: Dylan, a 21-year-old college student with ADHD and no financial knowledge.
goal: Understand what stocks and mutual funds are in plain language for a class assignment.
scenario: Dylan is preparing a short presentation for his economics class and wants straightforward explanations of stocks and mutual funds, including basic pros and cons, without complex jargon.
stopping_criterias: Dylan receives clear definitions and essential differentiators between stocks and mutual funds, suitable for a beginner’s presentation.

user_persona: Farah, a 35-year-old single mother with limited spare time and moderate internet skills.
goal: Get help creating a simple monthly budget to manage her expenses and save for her child’s education.
scenario: Farah is overwhelmed by monthly bills and unpredictable expenses. She seeks the assistant’s guidance in putting together a step-by-step template for a personal budget and suggestions for managing savings over time.
stopping_criterias: Farah possesses a basic outline to build her own budget and understands principles to help her track expenses and allocate savings.

user_persona: Greg, a 68-year-old retiree new to online tools and investments.
goal: Learn what an ETF (Exchange-Traded Fund) is and how it differs from traditional mutual funds.
scenario: Greg reads about ETFs in an online article but is confused by the terminology. He asks the assistant for an accessible definition of ETFs and a comparison with mutual funds, focusing on differences relevant to inexperienced investors.
stopping_criterias: Greg can explain in simple terms what an ETF is and name at least two differences from mutual funds.

user_persona: Chen, a 29-year-old gig worker who gets paid irregularly and wants to save for travel.
goal: Get strategies for managing income fluctuation and tips for regular saving, despite an unpredictable paycheck.
scenario: Chen finds it difficult to plan finances due to variable earnings. He seeks suggestions for budgeting with irregular income and advice on regularly setting aside money for a travel fund.
stopping_criterias: Chen can describe methods to stabilize savings and has actionable budgeting tips tailored for irregular income.
